intro: Sida vitifolia, commonly known as silverleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows in dry, disturbed habitats. The plant has small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are covered in fine, silver-white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Sida vitifolia is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It is often found in arid regions and can thrive in poor soil conditions.
